I'm working at Hawaii for Uber ! I always drive late at night. But the night is always full of unstable factors. It was just before two o'clock in the morning when I got a pick-up request outside a bar. When I got to the gate, a third person came up and kicked my car and insulted me. As soon as I got out of the car, I called the police and left the perpetrator behind. Passenger waiting to board and report to Uber that I am having an altercation with a third party. Later, the passenger canceled the ride, and Uber's security team called me, asked me to provide what happened, and permanently deactivated my account. I don't think it's my fault. In fact, I've been working at Uber for a year now. My rating is consistently above 4.97 and I drive over 4000 trips in a year. Uber deactivated my account, no one really knew what was going on, and the customer reported me to Uber without even getting in the car. At this point, I lost my means of earning a living just because I met a madman on the road

Your commitment to revolutionizing transportation and providing convenient rideshare services is truly remarkable. I would be honored to collaborate with Uber on a sand art project that visually celebrates the impact of your platform in connecting people and empowering mobility. I always drive late at night. But the night is always full of unstable factors. It was just before two o'clock in the morning when I got a pick-up request outside a bar. When I got to the gate, a third person came up and kicked my car and insulted me. As soon as I got out of the car, I called the police and left the perpetrator behind. Passenger waiting to board and report to Uber that I am having an altercation with a third party. Later, the passenger canceled the ride, and Uber's security team called me, asked me to provide what happened, and permanently deactivated my account. I don't think it's my fault. In fact, I've been working at Uber for a year now. My rating is consistently above 4.97 and I drive over 4000 trips in a year. I always drive late at night. But the night is always full of unstable factors. It was just before two o'clock in the morning when I got a pick-up request outside a bar. When I got to the gate, a third person came up and kicked my car and insulted me. As soon as I got out of the car, I called the police and left the perpetrator behind. Passenger waiting to board and report to Uber that I am having an altercation with a third party. Later, the passenger canceled the ride, and Uber's security team called me, asked me to provide what happened, and permanently deactivated my account. I don't think it's my fault. In fact, I've been working at Uber for a year now. My rating is consistently above 4.97 and I drive over 4000 trips in a year. Uber deactivated my account, no one really knew what was going on, and the customer reported me to Uber without even getting in the car. At this point, I lost my means of earning a living just because I met a madman on the road

I always drive late at night. But the night is always full of unstable factors. It was just before two o'clock in the morning when I got a pick-up request outside a bar. When I got to the gate, a third person came up and kicked my car and insulted me. As soon as I got out of the car, I called the police and left the perpetrator behind. Passenger waiting to board and report to Uber that I am having an altercation with a third party. Later, the passenger canceled the ride, and Uber's security team called me, asked me to provide what happened, and permanently deactivated my account. I don't think it's my fault. In fact, I've been working at Uber for a year now. My rating is consistently above 4.97 and I drive over 4000 trips in a year. Uber deactivated my account, no one really knew what was going on, and the customer reported me to Uber without even getting in the car. At this point, I lost my means of earning a living just because I met a madman on the road
